title: bug: JWT ID Token issued by cognito-idp can not be verified in v0.14.0 but can in 0.11.5
raw_output:
{'files_to_modify': ['localstack/services/moto.py', 'localstack/services/generic_proxy.py', 'localstack/services/edge.py', 'localstack/aws/spec.py', 'tests/integration/test_security.py'], 'reasoning': "1. localstack/services/moto.py: This is the main interface for Moto-backed AWS service emulation in LocalStack. Any Moto request patching, endpoint rewriting, or inconsistencies affecting JWT or JWKS endpoints from Cognito must be handled here.
2. localstack/services/generic_proxy.py: Handles proxying requests to backend services. Misrouting or missing handling of the JWKS endpoint, or Cognito-specific path handling, should be corrected here.
3. localstack/services/edge.py: Responsible for routing edge-service requests in LocalStack, which may be needed to properly expose '.well-known/jwks.json' or JWT endpoints for Cognito.
4. localstack/aws/spec.py: Contains AWS service specifications, used to match incoming requests to services. Changes to endpoint registration for Cognito or JWKS may require updates here.
5. tests/integration/test_security.py: While no Cognito/JWKS tests exist, this is the logical file for adding/adjusting integration tests to verify JWT/JWKS endpoint functionality."}
